article.headline: Jacksonville St. 97, Berry 89
article.story: JACKSONVILLE, Ala. (AP) -- Amadou Mbodji had a double-double with 17 points and 10 rebounds to help lead Jacksonville State to a 97-89 overtime win over Berry College Tuesday night. The Gamecocks led by as many as 13 points in the second half, but Berry chipped away at that lead and managed to tie the game up at 87-87 with 13 seconds left in regulation on a free throw by Will Blackwell. Stephen Hunter gave Berry an early 89-87 lead in overtime play with a layup 15 seconds into the period. Jacksonville started 12-point run with a 3-pointer by Jeremy Bynum with 1:57 to go in overtime and sealed the win. Bynum finished the game with 16 points. J.J. Wesley had 12 points for the Gamecocks, and Will Ginn and J.R. Weathers chipped in with 11 points apiece. DeAndre Bray helped out with 11 assists. Berry was led by Chris Clark, who was the game high scorer and had a double-double with 23 points and 12 rebounds. Jess Mullens had 21 points for Berry, and Daniel Ferguson added 16.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
